trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of dye spraying with magnification colonoscopy for detecting colorectal polyp.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluation of dye spraying with magnification colonoscopy for detecting flat adenomas in the colorectum

conditions.healthcondition: Patints receiving colonoscopy for standard indication.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: During colonoscopy, 0.2% indigo carmine solution was applied down the side-channel of the instrument using a 20mL syringe containing 5mL indigo carmine and a cushion of air. A minimum volume of 20ml of indigo carmine was applied diffusely to the entire right colon (defined as proximal to the splenic flexure), and in a targeted fashion to the left colon, on any suspicious areas of the colonic mucosa. Recruitment ceased when 200 patients had been recruited into each arm.
interventions.comparator: Standard colonocopy. Recruitment ceased when 200 patients had been recruited into each arm.

primaryOutcome.outcome: All polyps detected at colonoscopy were resected using standard colonoscopic techniques, and colorectal polyp numbers per patient were assessed.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After recruitment is stopped, colorectal polyps which were verified on histology were assessed.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: prevalence of colorectal polyp (the percentage of patients with at least one polyp)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: After recruitment is stopped, colorectal polyps which were verified on histology were assessed.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Consecutive unselected patients presenting for colonoscopy. Colonoscopy was performed for standard clinical indications.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Known polyposis syndromes, hereditary non-polyposis colorectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease and patients referred for polypectomy from other institutions. Additional exclusion criteria included: poor bowel preparation, incomplete colonoscopy, anticoagulant therapy and patient refusal.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim was to study whether indigo carmine dye spray colonoscopy increases a detection rate of colorectal polyp including flat adenoma in an Australian population.
